info.title: Document Cloud API
info.description:
## Documentation conventions The documentation does not show URL endpoints. Rather, it displays a path to retrieve endpoint details from the `resources` section of the /discovery result. For example, the documentation describes the call to exportpdf as: `GET assets.exportpdf`. `discovery_result.resources.assets.exportpdf` returns something like: ``` "exportpdf": { "http_method": "POST", "content_type": { "exportpdf_parameters_v1.json": "application/vnd.adobe.dc+json;profile=\"https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/exportpdf_parameters_v1.json\"" }, "accept": { "new_asset_job_v1.json": "application/vnd.adobe.dc+json;profile=\"https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/new_asset_job_v1.json\"" }, "uri": "https://dc-api.adobe.io/1467304330/assets?operation=exportpdf", "authentication": ["auth_header_primary"] } ``` But more importantly, `assets.exportpdf` is the parameter to the SDK `call()` method needed to identify the method. ## Versioning ### Compatibility When changing a given API method it is highly desirable to make those changes backwards-compatible. To facilitate this, clients should ignore result parameters that they do not expect (and, in general, a key in any dictionary). Backwards-compatible changes include * Adding a new method * Adding new parameters to a method that default to the previous behavior when omitted * Adding new options to input parameters * Returning new result parameters (clients should ignore results they don't expect) Incompatible changes include: * Removing a method * Removing input parameters * Changing the semantics of a method * Changing the name of a method, input parameter, or result parameter * Removing a result value Adding a new enum choice to a result parameter will sometimes be a breaking change, but at other times will be acceptable. For example, an API that performs document conversions will have an enum describing various conversion failures. Clients must be prepared to handle unrecognised additions to this enumeration. In other cases, enumerations may require that a client handle all possible variations. In this case extending the enumeration requires a new version of the resource. DC API documentation clarifies which enums are extensible without version changes. ### Versioning Mechanism When versioning becomes necessary, API methods are not directly versioned. Rather the data passed to them and returned by them is versioned by updating the reference to the JSON Schema. JSON Schema entries use a naming convention that incorporates a version number. Responses returning JSON include a Content-Type header corresponding to the schema of the result they are returning. Requests must include an `Accept` header indicating the schema(s) it is prepared to receive. If the client requests a schema that the server cannot support, the server returns a 406 `Not Acceptable` error. If the client provides a content-type that the server cannot consume, the server responds with a 415 `Unsupported Media Type Error`. ### Version Warnings When a client requests a resource version that's not the most recent, the response includes this header:
`x-version-available: `
When a client requests a resource version that has been deprecated, the response includes this header:
`x-version-deprecated: ` ### Versioning Example Versioning is managed on the principles of [server-driven content negotiation](https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec12.html). For example: `GET /foo` returns the content type: `application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"` `POST /foo` accepts the same content type. When we make a breaking change to the asset schema, we create a new version of the schema supported by both GET and POST: `https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json`. The caller to `GET /foo` may specify either: `Accept: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"` or
`Accept: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json"` Similarly, a request to POST /asset will accept either: `Content-Type: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"` or
`Content-Type: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json"` ## Consistency The Document Cloud API uses a model of "Eventual Consistency" in order to achieve high availability. Eventual Consistency means that clients may temporarily encounter inconsistent states while update operations are replicated throughout the distributed system. Examples of possible inconsistency: * Metadata for a recently uploaded asset may not be complete; for example, page count might not be populated. * Querying renditions for an asset may return a 404 response until the rendition has been generated. * Any read immediately after a write may return old information. A client that encounters an inconsistent state needs to take corrective action. Normally this action is simply to wait for a short duration and retry the operation. ## End Of Life Policy Adobe makes best the effort to minimize or avoid deprecating APIs and resources. APIs and resource versions are guaranteed to be supported for a minimum of 3 years from their release date. In order to mature and improve the quality and performance of the API, versions that are more than three years old might cease to be supported. APIs and resource versions will be supported for a minimum of 1 year after being declared as deprecated. Adobe will notify customers API resource versions planned for deprecation.
info.x-description:
Documentation conventions

The documentation does not show URL endpoints. Rather, it displays a path to retrieve endpoint details from the resources section of the /discovery result. For example, the documentation describes the call to exportpdf as: GET assets.exportpdf. discovery_result.resources.assets.exportpdf returns something like:

"exportpdf": {
  "http_method": "POST",
  "content_type": {
    "exportpdf_parameters_v1.json":
        "application/vnd.adobe.dc+json;profile=\"https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/exportpdf_parameters_v1.json\""
  },
  "accept": {
    "new_asset_job_v1.json":
        "application/vnd.adobe.dc+json;profile=\"https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/new_asset_job_v1.json\""
  },
  "uri": "https://dc-api.adobe.io/1467304330/assets?operation=exportpdf",
  "authentication": ["auth_header_primary"]
}

But more importantly, assets.exportpdf is the parameter to the SDK call() method needed to identify the method.

Versioning

Compatibility

When changing a given API method it is highly desirable to make those changes backwards-compatible. To facilitate this, clients should ignore result parameters that they do not expect (and, in general, a key in any dictionary). Backwards-compatible changes include

  • Adding a new method
  • Adding new parameters to a method that default to the previous behavior when omitted
  • Adding new options to input parameters
  • Returning new result parameters (clients should ignore results they don't expect)

Incompatible changes include:

  • Removing a method
  • Removing input parameters
  • Changing the semantics of a method
  • Changing the name of a method, input parameter, or result parameter
  • Removing a result value

Adding a new enum choice to a result parameter will sometimes be a breaking change, but at other times will be acceptable. For example, an API that performs document conversions will have an enum describing various conversion failures. Clients must be prepared to handle unrecognised additions to this enumeration. In other cases, enumerations may require that a client handle all possible variations. In this case extending the enumeration requires a new version of the resource. DC API documentation clarifies which enums are extensible without version changes.

Versioning Mechanism

When versioning becomes necessary, API methods are not directly versioned. Rather the data passed to them and returned by them is versioned by updating the reference to the JSON Schema. JSON Schema entries use a naming convention that incorporates a version number.

Responses returning JSON include a Content-Type header corresponding to the schema of the result they are returning. Requests must include an Accept header indicating the schema(s) it is prepared to receive. If the client requests a schema that the server cannot support, the server returns a 406 Not Acceptable error. If the client provides a content-type that the server cannot consume, the server responds with a 415 Unsupported Media Type Error.

Version Warnings

When a client requests a resource version that's not the most recent, the response includes this header:
x-version-available: <newer-version-content-type>
When a client requests a resource version that has been deprecated, the response includes this header:
x-version-deprecated: <version-content-type>

Versioning Example

Versioning is managed on the principles of server-driven content negotiation. For example: GET /foo returns the content type: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"

POST /foo accepts the same content type. When we make a breaking change to the asset schema, we create a new version of the schema supported by both GET and POST: https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json.

The caller to GET /foo may specify either:

Accept: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"

or
Accept: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json"

Similarly, a request to POST /asset will accept either:

Content-Type: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v1.json"

or
Content-Type: application/vnd.adobe.dc+json; profile="https://dc-api.adobe.io/schemas/foo_v2.json"

Consistency

The Document Cloud API uses a model of "Eventual Consistency" in order to achieve high availability. Eventual Consistency means that clients may temporarily encounter inconsistent states while update operations are replicated throughout the distributed system.

Examples of possible inconsistency:

  • Metadata for a recently uploaded asset may not be complete; for example, page count might not be populated.
  • Querying renditions for an asset may return a 404 response until the rendition has been generated.
  • Any read immediately after a write may return old information.

A client that encounters an inconsistent state needs to take corrective action. Normally this action is simply to wait for a short duration and retry the operation.

End Of Life Policy

Adobe makes best the effort to minimize or avoid deprecating APIs and resources. APIs and resource versions are guaranteed to be supported for a minimum of 3 years from their release date. In order to mature and improve the quality and performance of the API, versions that are more than three years old might cease to be supported.

APIs and resource versions will be supported for a minimum of 1 year after being declared as deprecated. Adobe will notify customers API resource versions planned for deprecation.

tags.x-description: Retrieve content regarding user accounts, limits, entitlements, recentsearches

get.summary: Return a list of available resources for the client
get.description:
This method is the entry point to DCAPI.  `GET /discovery` will return information on the set of resources and methods that clients will use to construct API requests.
 * URI values found in the /discovery result are [RFC 6570](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) compliant URI templates.  Clients must use a URI template library to produce URI values.
 * If the URI itself is parameterized, the name of the parameter will be returned in the `resource_parameter` property.
 * Method authentication is determined by the `authentication` array.  An API can support more than one authentication scheme. The possible values in the array are: `auth_header_primary, ticket, unauthenticated`. The most common value is: `auth_header_primary` which indicates the caller needs to populate an `Authorization` header with a primary access Bearer token.
 * If a method expects content, the request `Content-Type` header value must be populated with a value from the `content_type` map.
 * If a method returns content, the request `Accept` header must be populated with a value from the `accept` map.

  • URI values found in the /discovery result are RFC 6570 compliant URI templates. Clients must use a URI template library to produce URI values.

  • Method authentication is determined by the authentication array. An API can support more than one authentication scheme. The possible values in the array are: auth_header_primary, ticket, unauthenticated. The most common value is: auth_header_primary which indicates the caller needs to populate an Authorization header with a primary access Bearer token.
  • If a method expects content, the request Content-Type header value must be populated with a value from the content_type map.

version.description: The `version` property gives the current version of the service in semantic version format (see http://semver.org/).
version.x-description: The version property gives the current version of the service in semantic version format (see http://semver.org/).

compatible_range.description:
The `compatible_range` property specifies a semantic version range (see https://www.npmjs.com/package/semver).
Changes that might trigger some action on the client side can be described using appropriate values of `compatible_range`, independent of the value of version. For example, it may be possible that there is a functionally incompatible version change (say 1.2.3 to 2.0.0) that does not change output characteristics and therefore does not require any action on the part of the client, so compatible_range can be `>=1.2.3 <=2.0.0`.

*NOTE* Interface changes are not tracked using this mechanism.

In the case of the pdf_structure service, if a client is asked to redisplay a cached version of a file that has previously been processed by this service, the client should compare the version of the service that performed the original conversion against the compatibility range. If the range test fails, then the client is recommended to re-process the file through the service.
compatible_range.x-description:
The compatible_range property specifies a semantic version range (see https://www.npmjs.com/package/semver).
Changes that might trigger some action on the client side can be described using appropriate values of compatible_range, independent of the value of version. For example, it may be possible that there is a functionally incompatible version change (say 1.2.3 to 2.0.0) that does not change output characteristics and therefore does not require any action on the part of the client, so compatible_range can be >=1.2.3 <=2.0.0.

NOTE Interface changes are not tracked using this mechanism.

In the case of the pdf_structure service, if a client is asked to redisplay a cached version of a file that has previously been processed by this service, the client should compare the version of the service that performed the original conversion against the compatibility range. If the range test fails, then the client is recommended to re-process the file through the service.

get.summary: Provide asset export resource for different clouds
get.description: Provide all available import source options and their respective valid export destinations. This API should be used before importing an asset when allowing users to determine the destination of the asset. Usually this will be the same external provider. This API can also be passed an asset_uri, in which case it will return only the available export options for this specific asset.

parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.x-description: The expected content type of the asset source options response.

parameters.name: asset_uri
parameters.description: Pass the asset_uri of the asset you would like to export. Given this asset, the API will return the required token for each cloud this asset is allowed to be exported to.
parameters.x-description: Pass the asset_uri of the asset you would like to export. Given this asset, the API will return the required token for each cloud this asset is allowed to be exported to.

get.x-description: Provide all available import source options and their respective valid export destinations. This API should be used before importing an asset when allowing users to determine the destination of the asset. Usually this will be the same external provider. This API can also be passed an asset_uri, in which case it will return only the available export options for this specific asset.

get.description: Returns consolidated user information.  Use this method to return combined user information instead of requesting each piece individually. If no parameters are specified, defaults to identity, limits/conversions, and subscriptions.

200.description: Each value is represented by a map indicating the nature of the limit. Currently this is one of either `{"remaining": <value>}` or `{"limit": <value>}`. The `remaining` value indicates how many more documents a user may convert. A value of "-1" means the user has unlimited conversions remaining. A limit is an absolute value that does not have consumption characteristics.

200.x-description: Each value is represented by a map indicating the nature of the limit. Currently this is one of either {"remaining": <value>} or {"limit": <value>}. The remaining value indicates how many more documents a user may convert. A value of "-1" means the user has unlimited conversions remaining. A limit is an absolute value that does not have consumption characteristics.

get.description: For now, this API simply returns an indicator as to whether the user has access to any pdf related services.

get.summary: Return the current document cloud storage profile -- limits and usage.
get.description:
Each user is assigned a storage quota. The quota limits the total amount of storage space an user can use for files.
Renditions (thumbnails, previews, etc.) and preference data do not count against storage quota.
Conversions and uploads can create new persistent assets as long as they have remaining space. Once the user exceeds their quota, no further conversions to persistent assets nor uploads or imports of new assets are possible until the user frees up space or purchases additional storage space.
Requests that require more quota than is available will receive a 403 (forbidden) response. Quota is measured in gigabytes. (1GB = 1024MB = 1,048,576KB = 1,073,741,824Bytes = 2^30Bytes).
The purpose of the slop parameter is to allow users to exceed their quota limit once, but not by too much. i.e. The storage limit is calculated as quota + slop.

parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

Each user is assigned a storage quota. The quota limits the total amount of storage space an user can use for files.
Renditions (thumbnails, previews, etc.) and preference data do not count against storage quota.

get.summary: Retrieve preference data associated with a user/account.
get.description:
Returns a JSON object that contains values for user-settable preferences in the specified category for the current user.  If no prefs have been set for the current user in the specified category, an empty JSON object is returned. *NOTE* This API is intended for internal use only.
 
 Preference categories are meant to be narrow in scope, considering that components that write and consume preferences may do so across multiple platforms and environments. Category names and properties are approved before implementation and are limited to letters, numbers, underscore, and dash (`[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`).

get.x-description:
Returns a JSON object that contains values for user-settable preferences in the specified category for the current user. If no prefs have been set for the current user in the specified category, an empty JSON object is returned. NOTE This API is intended for internal use only.

Preference categories are meant to be narrow in scope, considering that components that write and consume preferences may do so across multiple platforms and environments. Category names and properties are approved before implementation and are limited to letters, numbers, underscore, and dash ([a-zA-Z0-9_-]+).

put.description:
Write a single category. A PUT on a category will replace the contents, no merging will happen on the server side. Clients are expected to GET the latest preferences and track the preference ETag prior to writing to minimize the chance of overwriting values. *NOTE* This API is intended for internal use only.
 
 Preference categories are meant to be narrow in scope, considering that components that write and consume preferences may do so across multiple platforms and environments. Category names and properties are approved before implementation and are limited to letters, numbers, underscore, and dash (`[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`).

get.summary: Retrieve subscription information for an user.
get.description: Returns an array of subscriptions/products that are associated with a given user.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.x-description: The expected content type of the users subscriptions API

parameters.name: extended
parameters.description: Indicate whether to include extended information: `status` and `billing_term` in the response (makes the request somewhat more expensive).
parameters.x-description: Indicate whether to include extended information: status and billing_term in the response (makes the request somewhat more expensive).

200.description: A list of 'product' objects. Each item in the list corresponds to an user's relationship to a paid or free subscription.  If there are multiple subscriptions, they will be returned in priority order (highest value product first): DCGlobal, DCEnterprise, AcrobatPlus, AcrobatStd, PDFPack, ExportPDF, ESign, SendNow, FillAndSign, CreatePDF, Files. Free entitlements that have been subsumed by paid products will not be reported.  e.g. The set of subscriptions returned for a PDFPack subscriber will not include a ExportPDF/Free entry.  Note that this API is intended to provide support for functionality such as up-sell and first time user experience.  This information should not be used to infer entitlements.

level.description: The service level.  All paid products have only a 'Basic' service level.
level.x-description: The service level. All paid products have only a 'Basic' service level.

status.description: Account status.  Any status other than `Active` indicates that services are not available to this account.
status.x-description: Account status. Any status other than Active indicates that services are not available to this account.

sub_ref.description: A UUID value that allows this product to be correlated to the Adobe store API values. This will be NULL for document cloud offerings sold to team (CCT) and enterprise (CCE) subscriptions as these users are entitled by an admin and do not have subscription record associated with them.
sub_ref.x-description: A UUID value that allows this product to be correlated to the Adobe store API values. This will be NULL for document cloud offerings sold to team (CCT) and enterprise (CCE) subscriptions as these users are entitled by an admin and do not have subscription record associated with them.

biz_source.description: The business source associated with this product purchase.
biz_source.x-description: The business source associated with this product purchase.

billing_term.description: This value will not be available for document cloud offerings sold to team (CCT) and enterprise (CCE) subscriptions.
billing_term.x-description: This value will not be available for document cloud offerings sold to team (CCT) and enterprise (CCE) subscriptions.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Additional file upload parameters.  If present, this must be the first part in the request body to facilitate streaming uploads.

options.description: Additional parameters for the upload operation.

name.description: The name for the asset.  The preferred way of specifying the filename, because the encoding can be specified as utf-8 for the options part to ensure that names that aren't strict ascii are properly handled.  If not present the name is taken from the filename in the Content-Disposition header of the file part.
name.x-description: The name for the asset. The preferred way of specifying the filename, because the encoding can be specified as utf-8 for the options part to ensure that names that aren't strict ascii are properly handled. If not present the name is taken from the filename in the Content-Disposition header of the file part.

ignore_content_type.description: If True, ignore the Content-Type header of the file part and figure it out on the server. Useful for browsers which may incorrectly guess content types.  This is a convenient alternate method of requesting auto detect instead of passing application/octet-stream in the file part headers (which may be difficult to do in some browsers).
ignore_content_type.x-description: If True, ignore the Content-Type header of the file part and figure it out on the server. Useful for browsers which may incorrectly guess content types. on_dup_name.description: How to handle a duplicate name.  This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.
on_dup_name.x-description: How to handle a duplicate name. This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.

persistence.description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted.  For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice.  If the choice is "permanent", then "parent_uri" must also be specified

post.summary: Import an Asset to Document Cloud
post.description: Bring an external asset into Document Cloud for processing. Imported assets are transient, they are temporarily available to perform operations but will not persist longer than 12 hours.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.description: Expected content type for document creation.
parameters.x-description: Expected content type for document creation.

parameters.description: The content type of the JSON request.
parameters.x-description: The content type of the JSON request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Import Asset Parameters

external_asset.description: External asset in the format "{source-provider}://path/{source-asset-path}", for example to get a OneDrive asset in "Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.xlsx", use "external_asset": "vnd-adobe-sharedcloud.x-onedrive://path/Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.xlsx"
external_asset.x-description: External asset in the format "{source-provider}://path/{source-asset-path}", for example to get a OneDrive asset in "Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.xlsx", use "external_asset": "vnd-adobe-sharedcloud.x-onedrive://path/Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.xlsx"

parameters.x-description: Import Asset Parameters

202.description: A response with job information: Details on how to poll for completion.

progress.description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress
progress.x-description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress

retry_interval.description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status
retry_interval.x-description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status

job_uri.description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion.  Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval
job_uri.x-description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion. Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval

asset_result.description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset
asset_result.x-description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset

error.description: If the status is 'failed', this will contain the error details

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view
code.x-description:
Code Description Affected Operations Corrective Action
QuotaExceeded The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. All Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError An error from the supporting cloud storage All Report Error to Adobe.

DocumentCorrupted The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. exportpdf, pdf_actions Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. exportpdf Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. exportpdf Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. All Remove document encryption.
TimeOut This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. All Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form exportpdf, combinedpdf Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. exportpdf, pdf_actions Remove Policy protection.
Unknown An unknown conversion error has occurred. Please report the error details. All Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty The file being converted was a zero length file. All Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size. All Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). exportpdf, pdf_actions Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError Error processing a Form File. Form processing Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. pdf_actions, exportpdf Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. pdf_actions, exportpdf Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. createpdf_from_html Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined pdf_actions Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf pdf_actions, exportpdf Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. export Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. pdf_actions, export Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). All Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. All Use a different name.
FileNotQualified This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf pdf_actions View file in classic view

post.x-description: Bring an external asset into Document Cloud for processing. Imported assets are transient, they are temporarily available to perform operations but will not persist longer than 12 hours.

post.summary: Export an Asset from Document Cloud
post.description: Take a Document Cloud asset and send it to an external provider using the export_uri found in discovery.sources_options. Only assets that have been imported can be exported, including the assets resulting from operations on imported assets.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.description: Expected content type for export operation.
parameters.x-description: Expected content type for export operation.

parameters.description: The content type of the JSON request.
parameters.x-description: The content type of the JSON request.

parameters.description: Export Asset Parameters

asset_uri.description: Document Cloud asset url. Note that only assets that were imported from an external provider can be exported.
asset_uri.x-description: Document Cloud asset url. Note that only assets that were imported from an external provider can be exported.

external_asset.description: Destination asset path in the format "{source-provider}://path/{source-asset-path}", for example to export a OneDrive asset as "Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.pdf", use "external_asset": "vnd-adobe-sharedcloud.x-onedrive://path/Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.pdf"
external_asset.x-description: Destination asset path in the format "{source-provider}://path/{source-asset-path}", for example to export a OneDrive asset as "Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.pdf", use "external_asset": "vnd-adobe-sharedcloud.x-onedrive://path/Documents/Reports/JanuarySales.pdf"

202.description: A response with job information: Details on how to poll for completion.

progress.description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress
progress.x-description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress

retry_interval.description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status
retry_interval.x-description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status

job_uri.description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion.  Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval
job_uri.x-description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion. Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval

asset_result.description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset
asset_result.x-description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset

error.description: If the status is 'failed', this will contain the error details

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ExportPDF operation parameters.

name.description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.
name.x-description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.

format.description: The exportpdf format. For image file formats, the output is a zip file containing images of all the pages.
format.x-description: The exportpdf format. For image file formats, the output is a zip file containing images of all the pages.

do_ocr.description: Whether OCR processing is performed on the PDF file or not. This setting is ignored for exportpdf to image.
do_ocr.x-description: Whether OCR processing is performed on the PDF file or not. This setting is ignored for exportpdf to image.

ocr_lang.description: Locale to use for optical character recognition (when `do_ocr` is true).
ocr_lang.x-description: Locale to use for optical character recognition (when do_ocr is true).

persistence.description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted.  For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice
persistence.x-description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted. For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice

parent_uri.description: The uri of folder to put the asset in.  This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.  If not specified, the default depends on the operation.  Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.
parent_uri.x-description: The uri of folder to put the asset in. This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets. If not specified, the default depends on the operation. Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.

on_dup_name.description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.
on_dup_name.x-description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.

image_params.description: Set of properties that are applicable when exporting to an image format.

image_format.description: The format of the image to generate.
image_format.x-description: The format of the image to generate.

resolution_dpi.description: Dots per inch. This can range from 9 to 600.
resolution_dpi.x-description: Dots per inch. This can range from 9 to 600.

max_dimension.description: Max dimension of any image in pixels. This can range from 32 to 8192.
max_dimension.x-description: Max dimension of any image in pixels. This can range from 32 to 8192.

quality.description: Controls the lossy compression setting.  "max" is best quality.  "min" is smallest file size
quality.x-description: Controls the lossy compression setting. "max" is best quality. "min" is smallest file size

draw_annotations.description: Specify whether to include PDF annotations in the output image file(s).
draw_annotations.x-description: Specify whether to include PDF annotations in the output image file(s).

use_transparent_background.description: If true, render the page backgrounds transparent.  Not applicable if the output is jpeg.
use_transparent_background.x-description: If true, render the page backgrounds transparent. Not applicable if the output is jpeg.

pages.description: Page range to be included. Page numbers are 1-based, comma seperated, and can include spaces (0x20, ignored) and a dash ('-', 0x2D) -- used to denote a range of pages.
pages.x-description: Page range to be included. Page numbers are 1-based, comma seperated, and can include spaces (0x20, ignored) and a dash ('-', 0x2D) -- used to denote a range of pages.

image_params.x-description: Set of properties that are applicable when exporting to an image format.

parameters.x-description: ExportPDF operation parameters.

202.description: A response with job information: Details on how to poll for completion.

progress.description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress
progress.x-description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress

retry_interval.description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status
retry_interval.x-description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status

job_uri.description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion.  Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval
job_uri.x-description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion. Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval

asset_result.description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset
asset_result.x-description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset

error.description: If the status is 'failed', this will contain the error details

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

SourceIsEmpty The file being converted was a zero length file. All Cannot convert this document.

GeneralFormError Error processing a Form File. Form processing Cannot convert this document.

PDFIsXFAForm PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. pdf_actions, exportpdf Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. createpdf_from_html Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined pdf_actions Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf pdf_actions, exportpdf Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. export Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. pdf_actions, export Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). All Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. All Use a different name.
FileNotQualified This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf pdf_actions View file in classic view

parameters.description: CreatePDF operation parameters.

asset_uri.description: URI identifying the Asset to convert to PDF
asset_uri.x-description: URI identifying the Asset to convert to PDF

name.description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.
name.x-description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.

do_ocr.description: Whether OCR processing is performed on the input file or not. This setting is applicable only when converting image formats to PDF.
do_ocr.x-description: Whether OCR processing is performed on the input file or not. This setting is applicable only when converting image formats to PDF.

ocr_lang.description: Locale to use for optical character recognition (when `do_ocr` is true).
ocr_lang.x-description: Locale to use for optical character recognition (when do_ocr is true).

ocr_type.description: OCR option to use for optical character recognition (when do_ocr is true).
ocr_type.x-description: OCR option to use for optical character recognition (when do_ocr is true).

on_dup_name.description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.
on_dup_name.x-description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.

persistence.description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted.  For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice
persistence.x-description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted. For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice

parent_uri.description: The uri of folder to put the asset in.  This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.  If not specified, the default depends on the operation.  Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.
parent_uri.x-description: The uri of folder to put the asset in. This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets. If not specified, the default depends on the operation. Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

Code Description Affected Operations Corrective Action
QuotaExceeded The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. All Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError An error from the supporting cloud storage All Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType Input file type cannot be converted to PDF createpdf, createpdf_from_html Cannot convert this document.

PDFIsPortfolio This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. exportpdf Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. exportpdf Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. All Remove document encryption.
TimeOut This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. All Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form exportpdf, combinedpdf Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. exportpdf, pdf_actions Remove Policy protection.
Unknown An unknown conversion error has occurred. Please report the error details. All Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty The file being converted was a zero length file. All Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size. All Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). exportpdf, pdf_actions Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError Error processing a Form File. Form processing Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. pdf_actions, exportpdf Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. pdf_actions, exportpdf Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. createpdf_from_html Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined pdf_actions Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf pdf_actions, exportpdf Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. export Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. pdf_actions, export Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). All Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. All Use a different name.
FileNotQualified This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf pdf_actions View file in classic view

post.x-description: Create a pdf from another source file.

post.summary: Combine organize or modify one or more PDFs
post.description: Apply a series of actions to a single PDF, or combine PDF files and apply actions to the aggregated set of pages. Combine one or more source documents into a single PDF. Apply actions to delete, rotate, duplicate, and re-order pages.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.description: The content type of the JSON request.
parameters.x-description: The content type of the JSON request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: PDF Action operation parameters.

assets.description: Asset URIs and operations for the final document.  Note that this array may contain a maximum of 12 unique asset URIs. Specifically, the array may contain more than 12 entries, but may not reference more than 12 assets.

asset_uri.description: URI identifying the asset to convert to PDF.
asset_uri.x-description: URI identifying the asset to convert to PDF.

include.description: A description of the pages to be included. Page numbers are 1-based, comma seperated, and can include spaces (0x20, ignored) and a dash ('-', 0x2D) -- used to denote a range of pages. Note that individual pages may be included more than once -- but with limits.  Any given page range may not result in more than 5 times the number of pages in the source PDF.  If no range is specified, all pages are included: "1-".
include.x-description: A description of the pages to be included. Page numbers are 1-based, comma seperated, and can include spaces (0x20, ignored) and a dash ('-', 0x2D) -- used to denote a range of pages. Note that individual pages may be included more than once -- but with limits. Any given page range may not result in more than 5 times the number of pages in the source PDF. If no range is specified, all pages are included: "1-".

page_actions.description: An array of page manipulation operations. Currently only the "rotate" operation is supported.

pages.description: A page range relative to the input document. See "include".
pages.x-description: A page range relative to the input document. See "include".

angle.description: Required for 'rotate' cmd. It specifies the clockwise rotation angle relative to the starting orientation of the page. e.g. if a page is already rotated 90 degrees (landscape), specifying a rotation of 90 degrees will rotate it a further 90 degrees.  The valid rotation angles are: 90, 180, 270.
angle.x-description: Required for 'rotate' cmd. It specifies the clockwise rotation angle relative to the starting orientation of the page. e.g. if a page is already rotated 90 degrees (landscape), specifying a rotation of 90 degrees will rotate it a further 90 degrees. The valid rotation angles are: 90, 180, 270.

page_actions.x-description: An array of page manipulation operations. Currently only the "rotate" operation is supported.

assets.x-description: Asset URIs and operations for the final document. Note that this array may contain a maximum of 12 unique asset URIs. Specifically, the array may contain more than 12 entries, but may not reference more than 12 assets.

pdf_actions.description: A set of actions to apply to the output PDF.

linearize.description: Specify whether to optimize the result for fast web viewing.
linearize.x-description: Specify whether to optimize the result for fast web viewing.

password_encrypt.description: Use a password to encrypt the PDF contents.

password.description: The password that will be used to encrypt the PDF and will be required to open the pdf.
password.x-description: The password that will be used to encrypt the PDF and will be required to open the pdf.

password_encrypt.x-description: Use a password to encrypt the PDF contents.

ocr.description: Perform OCR on the PDF file.  Note that the ocr action may not be combined with page_actions or page includes or other pdf_actions.

lang.description: The input language to use for OCR
lang.x-description: The input language to use for OCR

ocr.x-description: Perform OCR on the PDF file. Note that the ocr action may not be combined with page_actions or page includes or other pdf_actions.

tagged_pdf.description: Convert a PDF to tagged PDF file.  Note that the tagged_pdf action may not be combined with page_actions or page includes or other pdf_actions.

format.description: What format is the output.  \"well_tagged_pdf \" contains structure tags. \"fully_tagged_pdf\" contains additional information for dynamic viewing. \"instance_data\" contains machine learning output to allow clients to construct fully-taggged-pdf.
format.x-description: What format is the output. \"well_tagged_pdf \" contains structure tags. \"fully_tagged_pdf\" contains additional information for dynamic viewing. \"instance_data\" contains machine learning output to allow clients to construct fully-taggged-pdf.

compatibility_version.description: What version of fully tagged PDF should be returned .  By default, return the latest version.
compatibility_version.x-description: What version of fully tagged PDF should be returned . By default, return the latest version.

qualified_at_client.description: If the client has not qualified this file for conversion, run the qualifier to ensure the likelihood the pdf will successfully convert
qualified_at_client.x-description: If the client has not qualified this file for conversion, run the qualifier to ensure the likelihood the pdf will successfully convert

tagged_pdf.x-description: Convert a PDF to tagged PDF file. Note that the tagged_pdf action may not be combined with page_actions or page includes or other pdf_actions.

pdf_actions.x-description: A set of actions to apply to the output PDF.

name.description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.
name.x-description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.

persistence.description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted.  For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice
persistence.x-description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted. For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice

parent_uri.description: The uri of folder to put the asset in.  This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.  If not specified, the default depends on the operation.  Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.
parent_uri.x-description: The uri of folder to put the asset in. This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets. If not specified, the default depends on the operation. Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.

on_dup_name.description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.
on_dup_name.x-description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

post.x-description: Apply a series of actions to a single PDF, or combine PDF files and apply actions to the aggregated set of pages. Combine one or more source documents into a single PDF. Apply actions to delete, rotate, duplicate, and re-order pages.

post.summary: Create a PDF from HTML content
post.description: Create PDF from either a URL or a ZIP file asset. Caller must specify either a `url` parameter or an `asset_uri` parameter as the source for the conversion.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
