parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Input parameters to control the PDF creation.

asset_uri.description: URI identifying the Zip file to convert to PDF.  In order to render correctly, the Zip file must have a file named ```index.html``` at its root. Caller must provide either a URL or an asset_uri.
asset_uri.x-description: URI identifying the Zip file to convert to PDF. In order to render correctly, the Zip file must have a file named index.html at its root. Caller must provide either a URL or an asset_uri.

name.description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.
name.x-description: Name of the new asset. Duplicate asset name behavior can be set by on_dup_policy.

persistence.description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted.  For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice
persistence.x-description: Asset storage aspect as short-term transient vs. long-term permanent. "transient" creates an asset that will be available for several hours before being garbage collected and deleted. For operations that convert and download immediately, "transient" is the appropriate choice

parent_uri.description: The uri of folder to put the asset in.  This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets.  If not specified, the default depends on the operation.  Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.
parent_uri.x-description: The uri of folder to put the asset in. This parameter is relevant only for permanent assets. If not specified, the default depends on the operation. Conversions will be placed in the same folder as the source asset.

on_dup_name.description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.
on_dup_name.x-description: How to handle a duplicate name conflict in target collection for output file.

json.description:
JavaScript variables to be placed in global scope to reference while rendering the HTML. This mechanism is intended to be used to supply data that might otherwise be retrieved using ajax requests. The actual mechanics of accessing this content varies depending if rendering from a zip file or from a url. When rendering from a zip file, the source collateral must include a script element such as:
``````
When rendering from a URL, the content of this json object is injected into the browser VM before the page is rendered.
json.x-description:
JavaScript variables to be placed in global scope to reference while rendering the HTML. This mechanism is intended to be used to supply data that might otherwise be retrieved using ajax requests. The actual mechanics of accessing this content varies depending if rendering from a zip file or from a url. When rendering from a zip file, the source collateral must include a script element such as:
<script src='./json.js' type='text/javascript'></script>
When rendering from a URL, the content of this json object is injected into the browser VM before the page is rendered.

print_background_images.description: Determine whether to print background image properties.
print_background_images.x-description: Determine whether to print background image properties.

print_header_footer.description: Determine whether to add default headers and footers to the output pages.  The default header includes a short date and the contents of document.title.  The default footer includes a file name and a page n/m reference.
print_header_footer.x-description: Determine whether to add default headers and footers to the output pages. The default header includes a short date and the contents of document.title. The default footer includes a file name and a page n/m reference.

UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

post.summary: Download a zip archive of the specified assets

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The expected content type of the response - application/zip.
parameters.x-description: The expected content type of the response - application/zip.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type of the zip download request.
parameters.x-description: The content type of the zip download request.

parameters.name: Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the zip download request.

items.description: The uri of an asset to include in the downloaded zip file.
items.x-description: The uri of an asset to include in the downloaded zip file.

folder_uri.description: The uri of folder to download as a zip file.
folder_uri.x-description: The uri of folder to download as a zip file.

zip_file_name.description: The name to give the downloaded zip file.  If not provided, the default is documents.zip for assets, or the name of the folder for folders.
zip_file_name.default: documents.zip or the name of the folder for folders
zip_file_name.x-description: The name to give the downloaded zip file. If not provided, the default is documents.zip for assets, or the name of the folder for folders.

time_zone_offset.description: Time zone offset, in minutes, of the client's local time from GMT (e.g. for EDT, tzo=240). If this parameter is not specified the file modification dates in the zip file will be in GMT, this parameter allows the client to get a zip file with client local time mod times.
time_zone_offset.x-description: Time zone offset, in minutes, of the client's local time from GMT (e.g. for EDT, tzo=240). If this parameter is not specified the file modification dates in the zip file will be in GMT, this parameter allows the client to get a zip file with client local time mod times.

parameters.x-description: The parameters for the zip download request.

post.description:
Download the assets or folder with the specified ids as a single zip file. The intent of this API is to allow browser based clients to download multiple files with one action. It may also be useful for other purposes.

The parameters are passed in a json object in the request body.  You can either specify a list of up to 50 asset IDs, or a single folder ID.  A list of asset IDs will produce a flat (no folder hierarchy) zip file containing the assets. Note that it is possible to get a single asset in a zip file.  A single folder ID will produce a zip file that contains all the assets in the folder preserving the hierarchy of the folder specified (except empty folders are not included).

Be sure to specify the time_zone_offset parameter with the correct value for the local timezone the client is running in, so that the modification times in the resulting zip file will be as the user expects.

The response is a zip file. The default name for the zip file is "documents.zip" if you specified a list of asset uris, or the name of the folder for a folder uri. File names will be stored in the zip file in UTF-8 encoding. If there are assets in the list that have identical names, their names in the zip file will be modified to avoid ending up with duplicate names in the zip file (which many unzipping programs handle poorly). Clients that wish to avoid having duplicate filenames modified should restrict the set of files to all come from the same folder (thus ensuring there are no duplicates).

Limits
- The maximum number of assets allowed is 50.
- The sum of the sizes of the assets specified is not allowed not exceed 100 megabytes.
- The maximum number of folders allowed in the source hierarchy is 100 (note that even empty folders count toward this limit).

Notes
- There is no support for HEAD.
- Attempts will be made to pre-flight possible errors (such as inaccessible assets) before starting to stream the response. In the unlikely event that something goes wrong on the server after streaming has started (i.e. the 200 OK status has already been streamed), the streaming will be terminated asap and in such a way that the downloaded file is not a valid zip file - i.e. opening it with an archive utility will generate an error. This is basically the same as what would happen if the network connection was lost - the zip directory is the last thing in the file.
- The order of the assets in the zip file is undefined.
- The zip file will conform to the zip file format specified here: http://www.pkware.com/documents/casestudies/APPNOTE.TXT.

get.summary: Get a URI for either asset's paged rendition or asset's document rendition
get.description: This method will return a URI to be used to get an asset's paged rendition or asset's document rendition, optionally including a download ticket.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.x-description: The expected content type of rendition URI response.

parameters.name: make_ticket
parameters.description: If true, generate a download ticket valid for 30 minutes and include it in the uri.  Defaults to false.  Set true only for URLs that will be used from a web browser in cases that do not support setting an Authorization header. In all other circumstances, set false and use standard authorization.
parameters.x-description: If true, generate a download ticket valid for 30 minutes and include it in the uri. Defaults to false. Set true only for URLs that will be used from a web browser in cases that do not support setting an Authorization header. In all other circumstances, set false and use standard authorization.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of rendition_uri to return.  Defaults to 'paged' which maps to standard rendition endpoint (used for paged rendition formats like 'jpeg' and 'png').  Set to 'document' to get the 'document' rendition endpoint (used for document level rendition formats like 'ftpdf', 'jcos' and 'owp').
parameters.x-description: Specifies the type of rendition_uri to return. Defaults to 'paged' which maps to standard rendition endpoint (used for paged rendition formats like 'jpeg' and 'png'). Set to 'document' to get the 'document' rendition endpoint (used for document level rendition formats like 'ftpdf', 'jcos' and 'owp').

get.x-description: This method will return a URI to be used to get an asset's paged rendition or asset's document rendition, optionally including a download ticket.

get.summary: Retrieve asset page renditions
get.description: Get a rendition for a page of an asset.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The expected content type of rendition URI response.  Note that the Accept header does not determine the returned image format (see the format query parameter).  The Accept header must "accept" the type specified by the format query parameter.
parameters.x-description: The expected content type of rendition URI response. Note that the Accept header does not determine the returned image format (see the format query parameter). The Accept header must "accept" the type specified by the format query parameter.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Pass the value of the ETag header on a previous response to the same request to get a 304 if the asset hasn't changed.  Note that for renditions the ETag is that of the underlying asset - so if you ask for page 1, then pass the ETag to a second request for page 2, you'll get a 304 even though you haven't yet gotten the page 2 rendition.
parameters.x-description: Pass the value of the ETag header on a previous response to the same request to get a 304 if the asset hasn't changed. Note that for renditions the ETag is that of the underlying asset - so if you ask for page 1, then pass the ETag to a second request for page 2, you'll get a 304 even though you haven't yet gotten the page 2 rendition.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Image format to return.  One of "png", "jpg".
parameters.x-description: Image format to return. One of "png", "jpg".

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the rendition, if applicable to the format. The number of pixels on the longest edge, in the range [1..8129]; or "full", meaning full resolution for bitmaps, or 150 DPI for vector images.
parameters.x-description: The size of the rendition, if applicable to the format. The number of pixels on the longest edge, in the range [1..8129]; or "full", meaning full resolution for bitmaps, or 150 DPI for vector images.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Time to wait for rendition to be generated in seconds.  The default is 10 for smaller renditions, up to 60 seconds for larger renditions. If the default is not appropriate, use the smallest value possible. A maximum is imposed, which may vary depending on circumstances. If the wait interval is not long enough, this method will return a 404 (Not Found) response.  In that case, the application should re-try once.
parameters.x-description: Time to wait for rendition to be generated in seconds. The default is 10 for smaller renditions, up to 60 seconds for larger renditions. If the default is not appropriate, use the smallest value possible. A maximum is imposed, which may vary depending on circumstances. If the wait interval is not long enough, this method will return a 404 (Not Found) response. In that case, the application should re-try once.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero based) to render if the asset as multiple pages.  Default is 0.
parameters.x-description: Page number (zero based) to render if the asset as multiple pages. Default is 0.

parameters.name: markup
parameters.description: Render pages with or without markup (i.e. PDF files with/without annotations).  Default is true.
parameters.x-description: Render pages with or without markup (i.e. PDF files with/without annotations). Default is true.

parameters.name: processing_hint
parameters.description: A hint for how to render the rendition.  May be ignored depending on on size (currently sizes over 1200 is forced to quality_over_speed).  Default is speed_over_quality.
parameters.x-description: A hint for how to render the rendition. May be ignored depending on on size (currently sizes over 1200 is forced to quality_over_speed). Default is speed_over_quality.

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: If set to true, the return Content-Disposition header will declare the asset data as an attachment.  Default is false.
parameters.x-description: If set to true, the return Content-Disposition header will declare the asset data as an attachment. Default is false.

parameters.name: asset_rendition_uri
parameters.x-description: The resource URI

get.x-description: Get a rendition for a page of an asset.

get.summary: Retrieve asset page renditions
get.description: Get a rendition for a page of an asset directly, without having to get the rendition uri first.  Does not allow ticket authentication.

parameters.name: x-request-id
parameters.description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input.  If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.
parameters.x-description: A unique value identifying this request. If x-request-id is provided in the request, this value will be the same as the input. If not specified with the request, this value will be generated by the server.

parameters.name: x-api-app-info
parameters.description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests.  Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.
parameters.x-description: Free-form text that is used for debugging client requests. Should not be used for analytics or throttling. It provides the app name, platform and the version field associated with the client calling the API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The expected content type of rendition URI response.  Note that the Accept header does not determine the returned image format (see the format query parameter).  The Accept header must "accept" the type specified by the format query parameter.
parameters.x-description: The expected content type of rendition URI response. Note that the Accept header does not determine the returned image format (see the format query parameter). The Accept header must "accept" the type specified by the format query parameter.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Pass the value of the ETag header on a previous response to the same request to get a 304 if the asset hasn't changed.  Note that for renditions the ETag is that of the underlying asset - so if you ask for page 1, then pass the ETag to a second request for page 2, you'll get a 304 even though you haven't yet gotten the page 2 rendition.
parameters.x-description: Pass the value of the ETag header on a previous response to the same request to get a 304 if the asset hasn't changed. Note that for renditions the ETag is that of the underlying asset - so if you ask for page 1, then pass the ETag to a second request for page 2, you'll get a 304 even though you haven't yet gotten the page 2 rendition.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id in urn form
parameters.x-description: The asset id in urn form

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Image format to return.  One of "png", "jpg".
parameters.x-description: Image format to return. One of "png", "jpg".

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the rendition, if applicable to the format. The number of pixels on the longest edge, in the range [1..8129]; or "full", meaning full resolution for bitmaps, or 150 DPI for vector images.
parameters.x-description: The size of the rendition, if applicable to the format. The number of pixels on the longest edge, in the range [1..8129]; or "full", meaning full resolution for bitmaps, or 150 DPI for vector images.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Time to wait for rendition to be generated in seconds.  The default is 10 for smaller renditions, up to 60 seconds for larger renditions. If the default is not appropriate, use the smallest value possible. A maximum is imposed, which may vary depending on circumstances. If the wait interval is not long enough, this method will return a 404 (Not Found) response.  In that case, the application should re-try once.
parameters.x-description: Time to wait for rendition to be generated in seconds. The default is 10 for smaller renditions, up to 60 seconds for larger renditions. If the default is not appropriate, use the smallest value possible. A maximum is imposed, which may vary depending on circumstances. If the wait interval is not long enough, this method will return a 404 (Not Found) response. In that case, the application should re-try once.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (zero based) to render if the asset as multiple pages.  Default is 0.
parameters.x-description: Page number (zero based) to render if the asset as multiple pages. Default is 0.

parameters.name: markup
parameters.description: Render pages with or without markup (i.e. PDF files with/without annotations).  Default is true.
parameters.x-description: Render pages with or without markup (i.e. PDF files with/without annotations). Default is true.

parameters.name: processing_hint
parameters.description: A hint for how to render the rendition.  May be ignored depending on on size (currently sizes over 1200 is forced to quality_over_speed).  Default is speed_over_quality.
parameters.x-description: A hint for how to render the rendition. May be ignored depending on on size (currently sizes over 1200 is forced to quality_over_speed). Default is speed_over_quality.

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: If set to true, the return Content-Disposition header will declare the asset data as an attachment.  Default is false.
parameters.x-description: If set to true, the return Content-Disposition header will declare the asset data as an attachment. Default is false.

Content-Type.description: Mime type of the rendition.
Content-Type.x-description: Mime type of the rendition.

ETag.description: The entity tag, for use with If-None-Match on a subsequent request.
ETag.x-description: The entity tag, for use with If-None-Match on a subsequent request.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:

  * 'ftpdf' - Fully tagged PDF
  * 'jcos' - Streamable COS representation optimized for viewing
  * 'owp' - Open web platform representation for dynamic view

parameters.name: fallback

  * 'original' - Original asset
  * 'none' - No fallback aka 404

document_rendition_status.description: status of each type of document rendition - ftpdf, jcos and owp

ftpdf.description:
FTPDF document rendition status:
  * "not_started" - Rendition generation process has not yet started
  * "in_progress" - Rendition generation process is in progress
  * "failed" - Rendition generation has failed because requested rendition cannot be generated for this document
  * "eligible" - Document is eligible/qualified for that rendition
  * "not_eligible" - Document is not eligible/qualified for that rendition
  * "original" - Original document is already in the requested format
  * "available" - Requested rendition format is now available
ftpdf.x-description:
FTPDF document rendition status:

  • "not_started" - Rendition generation process has not yet started
  • "in_progress" - Rendition generation process is in progress
  • "failed" - Rendition generation has failed because requested rendition cannot be generated for this document
  • "eligible" - Document is eligible/qualified for that rendition
  • "not_eligible" - Document is not eligible/qualified for that rendition
  • "original" - Original document is already in the requested format
  • "available" - Requested rendition format is now available

jcos.description:

  * "not_started" - Rendition generation process has not yet started

  * "eligible" - Document is eligible/qualified for that rendition
  * "not_eligible" - Document is not eligible/qualified for that rendition
  * "original" - Original document is already in the requested format
  * "available" - Requested rendition format is now available

parent_uri.x-description: URI of the parent folder of this asset. If there is no parent (e.g. for a transient asset), this value is not present.

created.description: The creation date of the asset.

modified.description: The modification date of the asset.

last_access.description: The time the asset was last accessed.
last_access.x-description: The time the asset was last accessed.

last_pagenum.description: The number of the page last viewed.  This number is 0 based - the first page is 0, second page is 1, etc.
last_pagenum.x-description: The number of the page last viewed. This number is 0 based - the first page is 0, second page is 1, etc.

schema.description: Object consisting of selected fields of metadata

asset_id.description: The asset id (in URN form).  Use the "asset_uri" uri template in the "templates" section of the discovery info to transform to an asset uri.
asset_id.x-description: The asset id (in URN form). Use the "asset_uri" uri template in the "templates" section of the discovery info to transform to an asset uri.

parent_uri.description: URI of the parent folder of this asset.  If there is no parent (e.g. for a transient asset), this value is not present.
parent_uri.x-description: URI of the parent folder of this asset. If there is no parent (e.g. for a transient asset), this value is not present.

page_count.description: The number of pages in the asset.  Only present for assets in which the page count has been determined.  Page count discovery happens while generating renditions for supported asset types (e.g. pdf).
page_count.x-description: The number of pages in the asset. Only present for assets in which the page count has been determined. Page count discovery happens while generating renditions for supported asset types (e.g. pdf).

created.description: The creation date of the asset.

modified.description: The modification date of the asset.

last_access.description: The time the asset was last accessed.
last_access.x-description: The time the asset was last accessed.

last_pagenum.description: The number of the page last viewed.  This number is 0 based - the first page is 0, second page is 1, etc.
last_pagenum.x-description: The number of the page last viewed. This number is 0 based - the first page is 0, second page is 1, etc.

source.description: Where the asset resides.  Currently either "native" or "creative_cloud"
source.x-description: Where the asset resides. Currently either "native" or "creative_cloud"

favorite.description: True if the user has marked this asset a favorite.
favorite.x-description: True if the user has marked this asset a favorite.

starred.description: True if the user has starred this asset.
starred.x-description: True if the user has starred this asset.

200.description: A response with job information: Details on how to poll for completion.

progress.description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress
progress.x-description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress

retry_interval.description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status
retry_interval.x-description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status

job_uri.description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion.  Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval
job_uri.x-description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion. Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval

asset_result.description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset
asset_result.x-description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset

error.description: If the status is 'failed', this will contain the error details

**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view

progress.description: A value from zero to one hundred indicating the job completion progress

retry_interval.description: If the status is 'queued' or 'in progress' this specifies the number of milliseconds to wait before re-querying the job status

job_uri.x-description: If the job state is either 'queued' or 'in progress', use this URI to poll for completion. Note that this method should be called only after the interval specified in: retry_interval

asset_result.x-description: If the status is 'done', this will contain the details of the new asset

error.description: If the status is 'failed', this will contain the error details

code.description:
**Code** | **Description** | **Affected Operations** | **Corrective Action**
--- | --- | --- | ---
QuotaExceeded | The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. | All | Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError | An error from the supporting cloud storage | All | Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType | Input file type cannot be converted to PDF | createpdf, createpdf_from_html | Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted | The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio | This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. | exportpdf | Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables | This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. | exportpdf | Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted | This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. | All | Remove document encryption.
TimeOut | This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. | All | Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm | Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form | exportpdf, combinedpdf | Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected | Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Remove Policy protection.
Unknown | An unknown conversion error has occurred.  Please report the error details. | All | Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty | The file being converted was a zero length file. | All  | Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge  | The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size.  | All | Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange | The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). | exportpdf, pdf_actions | Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError | Error processing a Form File. | Form processing | Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified | PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm | PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. | pdf_actions, exportpdf  | Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput | Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. | createpdf_from_html  | Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded | This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined | pdf_actions | Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF | Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf | pdf_actions, exportpdf | Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination | This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. | export | Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins | Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. | pdf_actions, export | Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError | Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). | All | Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName | You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. | All | Use a different name.
FileNotQualified | This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf | pdf_actions | View file in classic view
code.x-description:
Code Description Affected Operations Corrective Action
QuotaExceeded The operation failed because some aspect of the user quota on the relevant storage cloud was exceeded. All Increase quotas or reduce usage.
CloudError An error from the supporting cloud storage All Report Error to Adobe.
UnsupportedMimeType Input file type cannot be converted to PDF createpdf, createpdf_from_html Cannot convert this document.
DocumentCorrupted The file appears to be corrupted and cannot be converted. exportpdf, pdf_actions Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsPortfolio This file cannot be converted because it is a portfolio. exportpdf Extract Portfolio contents and process them individually.
PDFNoTables This file cannot be converted as a spreadsheet because it does not appear to contain a table. exportpdf Cannot convert this document.
SourceIsEncrypted This file is encrypted and cannot be converted. All Remove document encryption.
TimeOut This file could not be converted because it took too long to convert. All Simplify content.
PDFIsEncryptedOrForm Source PDF is either encrypted or is a Form exportpdf, combinedpdf Remove document encryption or flatten the XFA Form.
PDFPolicyProtected Source PDF is policy protected and cannot be opened. exportpdf, pdf_actions Remove Policy protection.
Unknown An unknown conversion error has occurred. Please report the error details. All Document cannot be converted. Report Error to Adobe.
SourceIsEmpty The file being converted was a zero length file. All Cannot convert this document.
SourceTooLarge The file being converted was greater than 100 MB in size. All Cannot convert this document.
InvalidPageRange The page range specified for combine was invalid. Either invalid range syntax, bad page references, or results in a PDF with too many pages relative to the input PDF(s). exportpdf, pdf_actions Fix input parameters.
GeneralFormError Error processing a Form File. Form processing Cannot convert this document.
PDFIsCertified PDF cannot be processed due to document certification. pdf_actions, exportpdf Remove document certification.
PDFIsXFAForm PDF cannot be processed because it is XFA-based. pdf_actions, exportpdf Flatten the XFA-PDF to a regular PDF file.
InvalidHTMLInput Cannot create PDF from the provided HTML. createpdf_from_html Look at the message for hints on how to correct the HTML zip package.
FileCountLimitExceeded This request has exceeded the maximum number of files that can be combined pdf_actions Use multiple requests to combine large numbers of files.
InputMustBePDF Input file(s) for this request must have a mime type: application/pdf pdf_actions, exportpdf Convert file(s) to PDF before attempting this operation.
InvalidDestination This asset cannot be exported to the specified desitnation provider. export Check discovery.source_options for allowed destinations.
InvalidAssetOrigins Unable to mix assets from multiple origins. pdf_actions, export Only perform operations with assets from the same origin.
ExternalAssetError Unable to complete the request operation with the specified external asset(s). All Review error message for details on the external asset failure.
DuplicateName You can't have two things with the same name in the same folder. All Use a different name.
FileNotQualified This PDF file will not convert well into fully taggged pdf pdf_actions View file in classic view
